speaker: Ruins of Valoria
lines: Wind threads banners that forgot their colors and kept their pride.
Streets mosaic the sun in shards; glass remembers when it was sand and not yet a promise.
Arches wear ivy like armor. Statues wear names that rain washed into rumors.
A clocktower with no hands keeps perfect time with a broken heart.
Doorways breathe out cool air and the faintest spice of memory.
Somewhere a market calls for buyers that never stop coming. Somewhere a bell rings for no one.
You stand at a gate that was meant to open only once and never again.
The stones underfoot tilt the world a degree toward stories and away from sleep.
A crow plucks a thread from a banner and stitches the sky back together.

choices.text: Enter the Sun Plaza where the market used to sing.
Cross the aqueduct's spine into the high quarter.
Descend through a cracked gate toward the catacombs.
